      • step

        public Pipeline.PipelineBuilder step​(Pipeline.StepType type,
                                     java.lang.String name,
                                     java.lang.Object input,
                                     java.lang.Object output,
                                     java.lang.Object additional,
                                     boolean stopOnError,
                                     java.lang.String... params)
                              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Defines steps of an XML processing pipeline, will add the step to a list to be executed, but does not actually perform the processing.
        Parameters:
        type - Type of transformation or processing
        name - Optional name, can be null or empty String. Can be referenced from later steps in the definition of inputs or additional inputs with a prepended step:// to the parameters to feed the output of this step at the corresponding later point.
        input - Input file(s) as String or List of Strings, relative to the input path of the pipe, can be null or empty String if the output of the previous step shall be used. Using a prefix regexp:// will filter the input path for a regular expression provided as rest of the input. An Integer with value n will reference the output files of the nth step in the pipe. A prepended pipe:// will reference file names relative to the work path of the pipe, a prepended step:// will reference all output files of a previous named step. A prepended file:// will result in interpretation of the name as absolute. Glob syntax can be used.
        output - String or List of String, optional output file name(s), can be null or empty String (standard values will be generated). Provided file names have to be relative to the working path.
        additional - Possible additional file names which can be relative to the input path, work path (if prepended with step://, pipe:// or provided as Integer, see input) or relative to other references (e.g. path on FTP server or in ZIP file). See in the Wiki for more details.
        stopOnError - Defines whether pipeline execution should be stopped after an error in this step
        params - (Optional) parameters, see in the Wiki for possible values for different StepTypes
        Returns:
        Pipeline builder with current step appended to step list
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If one of the provided arguments does not fit the expected type. This prevents the pipe from being executed with false parameters.

      • errorStep

        public Pipeline.PipelineBuilder errorStep​(Pipeline.StepType type,
                                          java.lang.String name,
                                          java.lang.Object input,
                                          java.lang.Object output,
                                          java.lang.Object additional,
                                          boolean stopOnError,
                                          java.lang.String... params)
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Defines error steps to be executed if the processing pipeline failed to succeed, will add the step to a list to be executed, but does not actually perform the processing.
        Parameters:
        type - Type of transformation or processing
        name - Optional name, can be null or empty String. Can be referenced from later steps in the definition of inputs or additional inputs with a prepended step:// to the parameters to feed the output of this step at the corresponding later point.
        input - Input file(s) as String or List of Strings, relative to the input path of the pipe, can be null or empty String if the output of the previous step shall be used. Using a prefix regexp:// will filter the input path for a regular expression provided as rest of the input. An Integer with value n will reference the output files of the nth step in the error pipe. A prepended pipe:// will reference file names relative to the work path of the pipe, a prepended step:// will reference all output files of a previous named error step. A prepended file:// will result in interpretation of the name as absolute. Glob syntax can be used.
        output - String or List of String, optional output file name(s), can be null or empty String (standard values will be generated). Provided file names have to be relative to the working path.
        additional - Possible additional file names which can be relative to the input path, work path (if prepended with step://, pipe:// or provided as Integer, see input) or relative to other references (e.g. path on FTP server or in ZIP file). See in the Wiki for more details.
        stopOnError - Defines whether error pipeline execution should be stopped after an error in this step
        params - (Optional) parameters, see in the Wiki for possible values for different StepTypes
        Returns:
        Pipeline builder with current step appended to error step list
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If one of the provided arguments does not fit the expected type. This prevents the pipe from being executed with false parameters.

        public Pipeline.PipelineBuilder useExceptionHandler​(boolean useExceptionHandler)

      • useExceptionHandler

        public Pipeline.PipelineBuilder useExceptionHandler()
        Setting this attribute for a pipeline will activate exception reporting implemented in the ExceptionHandler class if a stopping exception occurs during pipeline execution.
        Returns:
        Pipeline builder with activated exception handling

      • exec

        public java.lang.Object exec​(java.lang.String... externalWorkPath)
        Executes the pipeline defined by the builder. This "consumes" the pipeline, no actual instance of it is returned. You can execute a new one from the last returned builder.
        Parameters:
        externalWorkPath - Injected work path. Is only used if none is defined in the pipe itself. If neither implicit nor external is provided, a temporary time stamped directory will be created in the work path of the application.
        Returns:
        Last step's output or Integer with value -1 if an error occurred during Pipeline execution code
